comment.author: 61849735@N00
comment._content:
From Wikipedia

Frances Alda (born Fanny Jane Davis) (May 31, 1879 - September 18, 1952) was a New Zealand-born soprano. She achieved fame as an operatic diva during the first three decades of the 20th Century due to her outstanding singing voice and colourful personality.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Date written is 4/29/13. The NYT the following day query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9502E2DA1F3AE633A... says that Geraldine Farrar, Frances Alda, and Mary Garden all left on the same boat , the Kaiser Wilhelm II, for Europe. This group of photos were probably taken on the boat.

comment.author: 32999340@N04
comment._content: First off, her real name is Fanny Jay Davis. She was "New Zealand's most favorite daughter who began her career in Europe, singing at Covent Garden, La Scala and the Opera-Comique in Paris, and became a star member of the New York Metropolitan Opera.

comment.author: 30073058@N00
comment._content: There is a full biography of Frances Alda in the Dictionary of NZ Biography: www.dnzb.govt.nz/dnzb/default.asp?Find_Quick.asp?PersonEs...
